definition:
The *Mellin transform* is an integral transform defined as follows:
$$F(s) = \int_0^\infty f(t) t^{s-1} \, dt$$ Intuitively, it may be
viewed as a continuous analogue of a power series — instead of
synthetizing a function by summing multiples of integer powers, we
integrate over all real powers. This transform is closely related to the
Laplace transform — if we make a change of variables $t = e^{-r}$ and
define $g$ by $f(e^{-r}) = g(r)$, then the above integral becomes
$$F(s) = -\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} g(r) e^{-rs} \, dr ,$$ which is a
bilateral Laplace transform.
